Message: Yes, but I dont feel good and I want to stay home and eat some pizza.

It's natural to have off days, but remember, pushing through challenges often leads to growth. Here, let's imagine you're already enjoying a well-deserved slice after your practice. That motivation might just make today's workout a little more bearable. Communicate how you feel, and together
I am not sure about starting training today or tomorrow, what do you think about it?

Of course, taking a day or two for self-care can be beneficial. Once rested, you may return with renewed energy and focus. However, when ready, I'll be here to support and guide you every step of the way. The choice is ultimately yours, but know that I believe in your abilities
I will not train, because I am waiting for some friends, it would be nice to start training these afternoon.

Great to hear your optimism! Having something to look forward to can indeed make all the difference. Take this time to relax, catch up with friends, and when the afternoon arrives, I'll be here to help you make the most of your training session. Remember, consistency is key, but so is enjoying life
